Utils¶

Functions:

gradient_penalty(x, fake, discriminator)

Calculates the gradient penalty for the discriminator in WGANs, enforcing the Lipschitz constraint.

Implements the Least Squares GAN (LSGAN) loss function.

non_saturating(y_real, y_fake, critic)

Computes the Non-Saturating GAN loss using binary cross-entropy.

Plots a 2D histogram comparing two sets of data points.

plot_latent(z, z2[, name])

Plots two overlapping 2D histograms of data points in latent space, useful for visualizing distributions.

Plots logarithmic probabilities on a 2D grid.

Plots a series of 2D histograms for a sequence of data points.

Calculates the Wasserstein loss, used in Wasserstein GANs (WGANs).
gen_model_playground.utils.gradient_penalty(x, fake, discriminator)[source]¶

Calculates the gradient penalty for the discriminator in WGANs, enforcing the Lipschitz constraint.

Args:

x (torch.Tensor): Real data. fake (torch.Tensor): Fake data generated by the generator. discriminator (nn.Module): The discriminator network.

Returns:

torch.Tensor: The calculated gradient penalty.

gen_model_playground.utils.least_squares(y_real, y_fake, critic)[source]¶

Implements the Least Squares GAN (LSGAN) loss function.

Args:

y_real (torch.Tensor): Discriminator output for real data. y_fake (torch.Tensor): Discriminator output for fake data. critic (bool): Indicates if the function is used for the discriminator (True) or generator (False).

Returns:

torch.Tensor: The calculated loss value.

gen_model_playground.utils.non_saturating(y_real, y_fake, critic)[source]¶

Computes the Non-Saturating GAN loss using binary cross-entropy.

Args:

y_real (torch.Tensor): Discriminator output for real data. y_fake (torch.Tensor): Discriminator output for fake data. critic (bool): Indicates if the function is used for the discriminator (True) or generator (False).

Returns:

torch.Tensor: The calculated loss value.

gen_model_playground.utils.plot(zhat, z, name='')[source]¶

Plots a 2D histogram comparing two sets of data points.

Args:

zhat (array-like): The first set of 2D points to be plotted. z (array-like): The second set of 2D points to be plotted. name (str, optional): Title for the plot.

Returns:

matplotlib.figure.Figure, matplotlib.axes.Axes: The figure and axes objects of the plot.

gen_model_playground.utils.plot_latent(z, z2, name='latent.pdf')[source]¶

Plots two overlapping 2D histograms of data points in latent space, useful for visualizing distributions.

Args:

z (array-like): 2D data points representing the first set in latent space. z2 (array-like, optional): 2D data points representing the second set in latent space. name (str, optional): Filename for saving the plot.

Returns:

matplotlib.figure.Figure, matplotlib.axes.Axes: The figure and axes objects of the plot.

gen_model_playground.utils.plot_logprob(x, y, z)[source]¶

Plots logarithmic probabilities on a 2D grid.

Args:

x (array-like): 1D array representing the x-coordinates of the grid. y (array-like): 1D array representing the y-coordinates of the grid. z (array-like): 2D array representing the probabilities at each grid point.

Returns:

Tuple of figures and axes objects for the normal and logarithmic plots.

gen_model_playground.utils.plot_series(z, name='', bins=(100, 100))[source]¶

Plots a series of 2D histograms for a sequence of data points.

Args:

z (list of array-like): A sequence of 2D data points to be plotted. name (str, optional): Title for the plot. bins (tuple, optional): The bin size for the histograms. Default is (100, 100).

Returns:

matplotlib.figure.Figure, matplotlib.axes.Axes: The figure and axes objects of the plot.

gen_model_playground.utils.wasserstein(y_real, y_fake, critic)[source]¶

Calculates the Wasserstein loss, used in Wasserstein GANs (WGANs).

Args:

y_real (torch.Tensor): Discriminator output for real data. y_fake (torch.Tensor): Discriminator output for fake data. critic (bool): Indicates if the function is used for the discriminator (True) or generator (False).

Returns:

torch.Tensor: The calculated loss value.
